item.title: Coronavirus: Review of 2m social distancing rule 'to conclude within days'
item.description: Pubs and restaurants might not survive under current guidance in England, industry leaders warn.

item.title: Coronavirus: Is the pandemic getting worse in the US?
item.description: Some states are seeing a spike in cases, but the White House says not to worry. So what's going on?

item.title: X Factor's Alexandra Burke reveals music industry racism
item.description: Alexandra Burke says she was told to bleach her skin and style her hair "to appeal to white people".

item.title: Greta Thunberg: Climate change 'as urgent' as coronavirus
item.description: Greta Thunberg says the world needs to treat climate change with similar urgency to Covid-19.

item.title: Beyoncé releases surprise new song, Black Parade, on Juneteenth
item.description: The new track, released on Juneteenth, calls for "peace and reparation for my people".

item.title: Anti-racism rally held despite 'stay away' warning
item.description: Police, politicians and Glasgow's council had asked members of the public to avoid George Square.

item.title: Coronavirus: New Covid-19 tracing tool appears on smartphones
item.description: The new "exposure notification" tool is part of an update to iPhone and Android operating systems.

item.title: Police warn over upcoming Black Country 'illegal rave'
item.description: Police intelligence suggests an illegal lockdown rave is planned in a remote Black Country spot.

item.title: Mariana Trench: Don Walsh's son repeats historic ocean dive
item.description: Sixty years after his father did it first, Kelly Walsh dives to the deepest point in Earth's oceans.

item.title: Galwan Valley: China accuses India of 'deliberate provocation'
item.description: A spokesman says Indian troops attacked Chinese soldiers but gave no details of Chinese casualties.

item.title: Inside Wuhan: Life after coronavirus lockdown
item.description: Two months after Wuhan’s lockdown was lifted, what’s life really like now?

item.title: How football can help displaced people 'heal, develop and grow'
item.description: A new photo project highlights the experiences of refugees through the language of football.

item.title: Ipswich library staff record audiobook for 102-year-old
item.description: Staff track down a 1927 out-of-print novel for one of their regulars who has fond memories of it.

item.title: Week in pictures: 13-19 June 2020
item.description: A selection of news photographs taken around the world this week.

item.title: India coronavirus: The stranded sailor yet to meet his daughter
item.description: Indian sailor Abhiram Oak has been stuck on his ship with little hope of replacement due to Covid-19.

item.title: Coronavirus: Designer develops mobile plastic shield
item.description: A UK plastics company has developed a personal, mobile plastic shield for use during coronavirus.

item.title: Protesters topple statues in US states
item.description: Hundreds of protesters gathered in several states to topple statues associated with slavery.

item.title: Father's day: These black dads share their experiences
item.description: A group of fathers answer questions from step-mums and birth mums by the woman who runs a group for blended families.

item.title: 'Having my identity stolen cost me £10,000'
item.description: The number of ID thefts in the UK in 2019 rose 18% on the year before to a record high 223,000.

item.title: The 94-year-old fighting for re-election after 49 years as mayor
item.description: Fifty years in public office has not dampened André Trigano's desire to be mayor of Pamiers, France.

item.title: Christmas 2020: Will Santa have to social distance?
item.description: With social distancing still in place and fears of a second peak, will Christmas outings be cancelled?

item.title: Marcus Rashford: Manchester United forward's campaign to make change happen
item.description: Marcus Rashford had time to think. Time to think about things he could never forget. That's when he decided to make change happen.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'Deadly masks' claims debunked
item.description: The BBC's anti-disinformation team has been investigating misleading claims about the health risks of face masks.

item.title: Debbie Kaore: The attack that highlighted an epidemic of abuse
item.description: After an assault on rugby player Debbie Kaore went viral, will things change in Papua New Guinea?

item.title: Vote: Which is the greatest European Championship goal?
item.description: We have come up with a shortlist of 12 goals - now we want you to tell us which you think is the best in European Championship history.

item.title: Premier League restart: Your guide on how to watch and listen to the top-flight's return
item.description: Your comprehensive guide on how to watch and listen to the restart of the Premier League - including channel listings for the BBC's free-to-air matches.

item.title: De Gea and Pogba - what next for Man Utd pair?
item.description: What next for David de Gea and Paul Pogba at Manchester United?

item.title: BBC Sport pundits Dion Dublin and Micah Richards open up on experiences of racism
item.description: Football focus pundits Dion Dublin and Micah Richards speak about their experiences of racism, with Dublin revealing he was racially abused at a supermarket.

item.title: Coronavirus: What's the chance of going on holiday?
item.description: Is it now possible to go on holiday, either in the UK or abroad?

item.description: Lockdown rules are changing to help single people cut off from family and friends.

item.description: A cheap steroid is hailed a big breakthrough in the treatment of seriously ill Covid-19 patients.

item.description: Statistics from England show more people from BAME backgrounds are dying than those from white ethnic groups.

item.description: With lockdown restrictions eased, people are starting to go back to work. But what are your rights?

item.description: Experts keep discussing the value of R, but what is it and why does it matter?

item.description: Across the world, people are being asked to wear face coverings to help stop coronavirus from spreading.

item.title: Coronavirus: Saffron Walden dentist shows new appointment routine
item.description: Join us on a walk through a dental surgery to show what you might face at your next appointment.

item.description: Our guide to different types of face coverings and step-by-step instructions on how to make them.

item.title: Coronavirus: Are protests legal amid lockdown?
item.description: Black Lives Matter protests continue in the UK - but are they illegal under restrictions on gatherings?

item.description: Identifying superspreading events could be crucial in the fight against the virus, scientists say.

item.description: The Royal College of General Practitioners is warning people not to mix up the symptoms.

item.title: Social distancing: A practical guide to how to socialise now
item.description: Meeting friends? Here's how to handle the awkward new rules - from sharing food to avoiding hugs.

item.title: Coronavirus: We answer kids' questions about going back to school
item.description: The BBC's Education Editor Branwen Jeffreys answers kids' questions about going back to school.

item.title: Lockdoon's naw fur me: Schoolgirl's cheeky poem gets FM approval
item.description: Schoolgirl Leah Begg's funny lockdown poem has attracted the praise of Nicola Sturgeon.

item.title: A Street Cat Named Bob: Stray who inspired series of books dies
item.description: James Bowen wrote six books about his pet Bob who he chanced upon while battling drug addiction.

item.title: Coronavirus: How charity shops are handling the nation's spring clean
item.description: How charity shop staff are preparing to be on the receiving end of the great Covid clearout.

item.title: Wicksteed Park: 'Theme park administration brings tears to my eyes'
item.description: People recall fond memories of Wicksteed Park as the Northamptonshire site goes into administration.

item.title: Premier League: Mystery over 'professional' haircuts
item.description: Fans are asking how some players managed to have such immaculate hairdos despite lockdown
